title: Desperate migrants scramble for daylight round tiny hole in side of lorry on M25

Migrants crammed into a lorry blink at the daylight after tearing a hole in its cover on Britain’s busiest motorway.

The extraordinary scene on the M25 was snapped by a horrified motorist just days before the Essex deaths horror.

Police were last night examining our exclusive picture and video footage taken near Heathrow airport.

The driver who took the images said: “It was in the middle of the day last Wednesday, just before the turn-off for the M40.

“It was a strange sight. It was hard to tell how many were inside, but it looked like they were crammed in tight.”

Motorway cameras could now be used to track down the truck and its movements.

(Image: publicityagent.co.uk)

Migrants are regularly picked up having got off trucks at service areas on the M25, London’s orbital motorway running through the home counties.

Cobham Services in Surrey has seen a spate of incidents.

In a single year some 117 people were arrested there on suspicion of immigration offences.

A 19-year-old Vietnamese woman is feared to be among the 39 migrants found dead in a lorry in Essex.

Truck driver Maurice Robinson, 25, who is known as Mo, is due to appear at Chelmsford Magistrates' Court on Monday after he was charged with 39 counts of manslaughter, conspiracy to traffic people, conspiracy to assist unlawful immigration and money laundering.

(Image: PA)

Robinson, who is from Northern Ireland, was arrested shortly after the bodies of eight women and 31 men were found in the refrigerated trailer attached to his Scania cab in an industrial park in Grays in the early hours of Wednesday.

All of the victims have now been moved from the vehicle in Tilbury Docks to Broomfield Hospital in Chelmsford, for post-mortem examinations to be carried out.

But families face an agonising wait to find out if their loved ones were among the dead after Essex Police launched "the largest mass fatality victim identification process" in the force's history.
description: EXCLUSIVE: This photo of sheer despair was taken on Britain's busiest motorway just days before 39 migrants were found dead in a separate lorry in Essex
